background: A clinic conducts throat or nasal swabs on patients with limited time and specific requirements for the minimum number of nasal swabs and the ratio between throat and nasal swabs.
constraints: Time for throat swabs is non-negative
Time for nasal swabs is non-negative
At least MinNasalSwabs nasal swabs must be administered
At least ThroatNasalRatio times as many throat swabs as nasal swabs must be done
The total time for administering both types of swabs cannot exceed TotalTime minutes
objective: Maximize the number of patients seen by determining the number of each type of swab to perform
description: A clinic is conducting throat or nasal swabs on each patient. A throat swab takes \param{ThroatSwabTime} minutes while a nasal swab takes \param{NasalSwabTime} minutes. The clinic must administer at least \param{MinNasalSwabs} nasal swabs. Since the nasal swab is more uncomfortable, at least \param{ThroatNasalRatio} times as many throat swabs must be done as nasal swabs. If the clinic is only operational for \param{TotalTime} minutes, how many of each swab should be done to maximize the number of patients seen?

parameters.definition: Time taken for one throat swab
Time taken for one nasal swab
Minimum number of nasal swabs to be administered
Minimum ratio of throat swabs to nasal swabs
